@graph.description: You think tofu is boring and has a plain taste? Then try this tofu marinade! It's super easy to make and it's packed with flavor.

@graph.name: Tofu Marinade
@graph.description: You think tofu is boring and has a plain taste? Then try this tofu marinade! It's super easy to make and it's packed with flavor. I love serving my marinated tofu over brown rice and don't forget to top it off with some green onions and a bit of sriracha.

recipeInstructions.text: Start by pressing your tofu. Remove the tofu from the packaging.Then wrap it with a clean dishtowel. Alternatively, you could also use paper towels.Cover with a baking sheet and then place something heavy on top. I usually use a stack of cookbooks. But you could also use cans of beans, a cast iron skillet, or smaller weights you use for weight lifting exercises. Let it press for about 10-15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the tofu marinade. Cut the garlic and the ginger into thin slices. In an airtight container or a bowl, combine all of the ingredients and whisk well.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, make the tofu marinade. Cut the garlic and the ginger into thin slices. In an airtight container or a bowl, combine all of the ingredients and whisk well.

recipeInstructions.text: After the tofu has been pressed for about 10-15 minutes, cut it into cubes.  Then add it to the tofu marinade and carefully stir with a spoon until all of the tofu cubes are covered.
recipeInstructions.name: After the tofu has been pressed for about 10-15 minutes, cut it into cubes.  Then add it to the tofu marinade and carefully stir with a spoon until all of the tofu cubes are covered.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the container and store it in the fridge for at least 1-2 hours. If you have enough time, I recommend letting the tofu marinate overnight. This way it will be even more flavorful.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover the container and store it in the fridge for at least 1-2 hours. If you have enough time, I recommend letting the tofu marinate overnight. This way it will be even more flavorful.

recipeInstructions.text: To pan-fry the marinated tofu:Heat some oil in a frying pan or in a cast iron skillet.Add the marinated tofu, but leave the rest of the tofu marinade behind (you can use it later if you want). Fry the tofu until golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: To pan-fry the marinated tofu:Heat some oil in a frying pan or in a cast iron skillet.Add the marinated tofu, but leave the rest of the tofu marinade behind (you can use it later if you want). Fry the tofu until golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: How to bake the marinated tofu:Preheat your oven to 350 °F. After the tofu has been marinated for at least 1-2 hours, place it in a bowl leaving the remaining tofu marinade behind.Add two tablespoons of corn starch (for 14 ounces of tofu). Make sure all cubes are covered in corn starch. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the tofu cubes on top.Bake for 25 minutes, tossing halfway.

Make sure all cubes are covered in corn starch. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the tofu cubes on top.Bake for 25 minutes, tossing halfway.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve over brown rice and sprinkle with chopped green onions. I also like to add a bit of sriracha on top.
